intro: Shirakiopsis elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic shirakiopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
